intro: Amphipogon gracilis, commonly known as the slender sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It typically features a rosette of narrow, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers clustered in dense inflorescences, which bloom in early spring. Its root system is extensive and adapted for nutrient absorption in poor soils. Amphipogon gracilis is often found in sandy or gravelly habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
